multimonster.edit
Interface EditFacade

All Superinterfaces:
ResourceWaiter
All Known Implementing Classes:
EditImplBean
public interface EditFacade
extends ResourceWaiter

the edit component proviedes content-based modifications for mediadata. It uses jobs to specifiy a number of tasks to modify the mediadata.

Author:
Holger Velke (sihovelk)

Method Summary

Method Detail

getJob

public EditJobIdentifier getJob(UserIdentifier uId,
                                MOIdentifier mOId)
                         throws EditException
creats a new job for the specified user. Uses the specified mediaobject as source for the job.

Parameters:
uId - the owner of the job
mOId - the source media object
Returns:
the id of the job
Throws:
EditException

addTaskToJob

public EditTaskIdentifier addTaskToJob(EditJobIdentifier jobId,
                                       FilterPlugInIdentifier filterId,
                                       FilterAction action)
                                throws EditException
creates a new task fo the specified filter snd the specified action and adds it to the job.

Parameters:
jobId - the job to add the task
filterId - the filter to use
action - the parameters for the filter
Returns:
the id of the created task
Throws:
EditException

finishJob

public MOIdentifier finishJob(EditJobIdentifier jobId,
                              MetaData metaData,
                              QueueTime maxQT)
                       throws EditException
Causes the edit component to finish the job. No tasks can be added. The edit progress begins if resources are available.

Parameters:
jobId - the id of the job to finish
metaData - the metadata for the new media object created by the job
maxQT - the maximal duration to wait for resources. if null it will try to start immediatelly, if there are no resources available it will give up
Returns:
the mediaobjectid of the new created mediaobject
Throws:
EditException

removeTask

public void removeTask(EditTaskIdentifier taskId)
                throws EditException
removes the spicified task from it's job

Parameters:
taskId - the task to remove
Throws:
EditException

abortJob

public void abortJob(EditJobIdentifier jobId)
              throws EditException
aborts the job specifed by the jobId. This is only possible until finishJob() is call for the job.

Parameters:
jobId - the id of the job to abort
Throws:
EditException

getJobList

public EditJobIdentifier[] getJobList(UserIdentifier uId)
                               throws EditException
Parameters:
uId - the id of the user
Returns:
all jobs of the specified user
Throws:
EditException
